--- title: "1-salary-linear-reg" code-fold: true --- :::{.callout-note title="ç®€ä»‹"} > explore `YearsExperience` and `Salary` relationship 1. dataset: [`kaggle salary dataset`](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/abhishek14398/salary-dataset-simple-linear-regression) 2. æ•°æ®ç±»åž‹éœ€è¦åšè½¬æ¢: `to_ScienceType(d)=coerce(d,:YearsExperience=>Continuous,:Salary=>Continuous)` 3. using `MLJLinearModels.jl` [ðŸ”—](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/MLJLinearModels.jl) ::: ## 1. load package ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} include("../utils.jl") import MLJ:fit!,fitted_params using GLMakie,MLJ,CSV,DataFrames ``` ::: ## 2. process data ::: {.panel-tabset} # `load(csv)->dataframe` ==> ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.julia .cell-code code-fold="show"} df=CSV.File("./data/salary_dataset.csv") |> DataFrame |> dropmissing; first(df,5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
5Ã—3 DataFrame

``` ::: ::: # `sciencetype` ==> ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.julia .cell-code} to_ScienceType(d)=coerce(d,:YearsExperience=>Continuous,:Salary=>Continuous) new_df=to_ScienceType(df) first(new_df,5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: # `MLJ table` ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.julia .cell-code} X=MLJ.table(reshape(new_df[:,2],30,1)) y=Vector(new_df[:,3]) show(y) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [39344.0, 46206.0, 37732.0, 43526.0, 39892.0, 56643.0, 60151.0, 54446.0, 64446.0, 57190.0, 63219.0, 55795.0, 56958.0, 57082.0, 61112.0, 67939.0, 66030.0, 83089.0, 81364.0, 93941.0, 91739.0, 98274.0, 101303.0, 113813.0, 109432.0, 105583.0, 116970.0, 112636.0, 122392.0, 121873.0] ``` ::: ::: ::: ## 3. MLJ workflow ### 3.1 load model ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.julia .cell-code code-fold="false"} LinearRegressor = @load LinearRegressor pkg=MLJLinearModels model=LinearRegressor() mach = MLJ.fit!(machine(model,X,y)) fp=MLJ.fitted_params(mach) #å­¦ä¹ çš„æ¨¡åž‹å‚æ•° ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` [ Info: For silent loading, specify `verbosity=0`. [ Info: Training machine(LinearRegressor(fit_intercept = true, â€¦), â€¦). â”Œ Info: Solver: MLJLinearModels.Analytical â”‚ iterative: Bool false â”” max_inner: Int64 200 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` import MLJLinearModels âœ” ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ``` (coefs = [:x1 => 9449.962321455077], intercept = 24848.203966523164,) ``` ::: ::: ### 3.2 build linear function ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.julia .cell-code} a=fp.coefs[1,1][2] b=fp.intercept line_func(t)=a*t+b ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ``` line_func (generic function with 1 method) ``` ::: ::: ## 4. plot results ::: {.cell execution_count=7} ``` {.julia .cell-code} xs=range(extrema(new_df[:,2])...,200) fig=Figure() ax=Axis(fig[1,1];xlabel="YearsExperience",ylabel="Salary") lines!(ax,xs,line_func.(xs);label="fit-line",linewidth=3) scatter!(ax,new_df[:,2],new_df[:,3];label="data",marker_style...) axislegend(ax) fig ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ![](1-salary-linear-reg_files/figure-html/cell-8-output-1.png){} ::: :::
